intro: Thlaspi heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable cabbages or the common rock cabbages, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. It has basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
